Definition: We imagine what it would be like to suddenly become all-seeing in such a God-like fashion.

Theme: what if I met a Viking
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like to meet a genuine Viking.

Theme: what if I repeated a portion of my life over and over again
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like if through some kind of time travel phenomenon we got to relive a portion of our life over repeatedly but with our memories from time  to time intact.

Theme: what if I was cast into a lawless dungeon and had to fight for survival
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like to face this peculiar situation.

Theme: what if my partner switched gender
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like if our partner (in the romantic sense) suddenly switched gender for some reason.

Theme: what if people around me started disappearing one by one
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like if people around us just started to mysteriously disappear  one after the other.

Theme: what if the world was continually rearranging itself around me
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it'd be like to find the world suddenly changing inconsistently around us.

Theme: what if there was a huge robotic war
Definition: We imagine what society would be like if it was in disarray because of a worldwide war between autonomous robots.

Theme: what if there were people with out of control psychokinetic powers
Definition: We imagine what the world and society would be like if there were some individuals around that had immense supernatural powers but were not entirely able to control them.

Theme: what if two people were combined into one person
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We are made to imagine the hypothetical scenario that two people are somehow combine into one, typically receiving physical and mental traits from both progenitors and having the memories of both.

Theme: what it's like to be a bum
Definition: We are made to ponder what life is like for a poor downtrodden man or woman  living on the streets.
The question of where humans came from is pondered.
Someone wrestles with the rather basic life decision of where to settle down and live out at least a good portion of their life.

Theme: why good people do bad things
Definition: The philosophical question of what can cause an otherwise good person to commit a crime is discussed.
The outrageous notion that a woman might make the first move on a man to initiate  a conventional heterosexual romantic affair is floated.
Two or more people squabbling over common workplace issues such as pecking order and promotion, are featured.
An AI goes amok and makes trouble for society.
The story comments on what a poor disgusting thing the human body is, usually as seen from the point of view of a hypothetical artificial being.
Someone has a pathological fear of germs and takes extraordinary precautions to keep away from them.
Obsessive-compulsive disorder: someone has a pathological need to need to check things repeatedly, perform certain routines repeatedly, etc. Often featured as  repeated cleaning.

Theme: what if people around me started falling mysteriously ill one by one
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like if people around us one by one contracted mysterious ailments.
Two highly magnetized, rotating neutron stars or white dwarfs that emit beams of electromagnetic  radiation rotate about each other and a common center of gravity.

Theme: coping with an overly vigorous massage
Definition: Someone has to put up with an excruciatingly rough rubbing-down.

Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like to age significantly faster than what is normal.

Theme: coping with being at the brink of destruction
Definition: Someone, alone or in company with others, is harrowed and on the brink of destruction and manages to go on only by the skin of their teeth. Typically they are dirty, injured, thorned and impoverished.
Technology that goes beyond mere space and is capable of altering history itself, usually while  leaving the operator safe from the resulting changes.
We imagine what the world would be like if certain ways of thinking could be detected and punished by the government.
Society is peaceful and amicable because people can hear each others' thoughts and have learned to control their anti-social instincts.
The social implications of there being violent individuals around is discussed.
That legally prohibiting an activity tends to give rise to a black market for that activity, is featured.
The question of whether it is alright to deprive someone of their freedom as punishment for some offense is discussed.

Theme: seeing something through to the end
Definition: Someone inspects or is confronted with their own tendency to leave things  unfinished and their resolve to instead see things through to the end.
The social implications of there being people who steal other people's lawful property are featured.
The mechanical principles that underly various types of flying are discussed.
Technology that can bring someone back from death many hours after they are technically dead.
Someone is about to commit suicide and someone else tries to talk them out of it.
Someone becomes a godfather or godmother.
The relationship between a godparent and their godchild is featured.
The idea that dreams are something real that, consequently, can be entered by  other people and so on.
There's an alien species the members of which can enter the dreams of other people.
Peoples' nightmares and people having nightmares is featured in detail.

Theme: what if people around me started falling into comas one by one
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it'd be like to see people around us fall into comas one after the other.
The idea that people can literally share the same dream and transmit information  from one to the other in it.
The way we can sometimes dream with full awareness and control of our dream is featured.
The importance of, for example, not telling fools they are fools straight to their face is featured.
A way of communicating in some kind of realtime across the vast distances of the galaxy.

Theme: coping with the defeat of one's people
Definition: Someone deals with the news that their people have been defeated.
An alien whose primary raison d'être is to hunt other aliens for sport and take their body parts as trophies.
The prey's struggle for survival against the hunter is featured.
Someone deals with the psychological problems that can come from being violated.
The problem of ensuring impartiality in the legal system is highlighted. We all suffer from various preconceptions and judges are no exception.
The fact that one's reputation is of vital importance to one's well being is highlighted.
Hypnosis used to bring out buried or suppressed old memories.
The simple fact that pure firepower is important to the outcome of conflict is highlighted.
A collection of French movements that fought against the Nazi German occupation of  France and against the collaborationist Vichy régime during the Second World War
Simulated hunting in a virtual reality environment is used as a substitute for the real thing.

A global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945. It was the most widespread war in history and directly involved more than 100 million people from over 30 countries. Towards the end the participants had formed two opposing military alliances called "the Allies" and "the Axis".
A collection of more or less complicated algorithms for encryption. These are strategies for writing messages such that they can only be read by those who know the secret to  decoding them.

Theme: what if I were hunted for sport
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it'd be like to be hunted for sport by some superiorly armed and sadistic adversary.
The ideology and set of practices associated with the 20th-century German  Nazi Party are discussed.

Theme: what if I found myself in the body of an alien
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like to suddenly find ourselves inhabiting the body of an alien of some sort.

Theme: feeling tied down in a relationship
Definition: Someone in an otherwise functional relationship re-thinks whether this commitment is preventing them from pursuing more enticing goals in life.

The oft ridiculed male reluctance to engage in or stay with a long-term exclusive romantic commitment, even when it is otherwise good, is featured. While this fear is not exclusive to males, it is notably featured as a male stereotype in some stories.

A process by which the consciousness inhabiting one body is swapped with that  inhabiting another body. Each consciousness thus ends up in another body than where it began. Normally only two bodies are involved but the theme does not preclude  the possibility that there are three or more bodies that each end up with a different consciousness than it began with.
An alien who has the ability to swap bodies with someone else. This means the target body's former consciousness ends up in the alien's former body, and vice versa.
Someone pursues a higher ideal like those of the world religions, for example the  Christian salvation or the Buddhist Nirvana.

Theme: what if my lover suddenly couldn't remember me
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: Someone suddenly finds that their lover has lost all memories of them.
An alien species who cannot be remembered by those they encounter some time after the encounter.
Some group in society seek to rewrite history in a way that makes it more advantageous to them. This typically involves glossing over inconvenient truths as well as outright lying.
The methodology of historians studying history. This involves things like the role of  primary evidence.
An alien that can copy the shape of other aliens. An original is needed to stand model.

Theme: coping with an unwelcome house guest
Definition: A reluctant host has to suffer through having a guest that they would rather not have.
A guest deals with the antics of a host that would rather not have them there.
Two male characters exchange banter as males are known to do.
Someone has to deal with being alone for a prolonged period of time.
Someone is irrationally afraid of being in a confined space.

Theme: too good to be true decision
Definition: An opportunity that is advantageous but unlikely manifests and one must decide on how to act; it could be a ruse by an unknown adversary.

Theme: if it sounds too good to be true it probably isn't true
Definition: The age-old adage is illustrated: If circumstances that are extremely advantageous too you manifest against the odds, you should seriously consider that someone  (possibly your self) is simply deceiving you.
There is an alien that speaks many languages.

Theme: what if I was trapped in a void of nothingness
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: A character is trapped in a void.
The social problem over how to handle various toxic byproducts is discussed.
Two or more sovereign entities squabble over something related to the environment. For example, one nation's damming of a river may threaten a downstream nation's economy.

Theme: suppression of a technology to preserve an industry
Definition: The following social problem is featured: People with vested interests try to suppress  new technology in order to preserve the potentially antiquated industry they have shares in.
Someone exhibits an irrational fear of nothingness.

Theme: coping with a friend who is suffering from depression
Definition: Someone has to deal with having a friend who is more or less clinically depressed.
Someone has strong feelings of guilt associated with surviving an event in which others perished.
The putative human right to keep some affairs and doings private is discussed.
Someone engages in deliberately reckless behavior or outright self-harm.
Someone experiences the feeling of exuberance that can sometimes come with a perilous situation.
Two parties in a conflict, like the Cold War, try to gradually back down and  defuse the situation.
Someone, typically a parent, struggles with how to explain death and dying to a child.
A mental disorder characterized by at least two distinct and relatively enduring  identities or dissociated personality states.

Medical experiments are carried out on humans and we are asked question such as: Can the ends can justify the means when someone tests medical procedures  and drugs on patients without their informed consent? Is it right to use knowledge that was obtained through atrocities such as the Nazi experimentation in German concentration camps?
The idea in medical ethics that to the extent possible, a patient should not be subjected  to a treatment unless they have consented to it with a clear understanding of its implications.
The sadly familiar social issue of people around the worlds not being able to  agree on what to do about climate change is featured. A kind of tragedy of the commons.
Someone has to come to terms with being incarcerated.
There is a planet that is almost 100% water through and through.
A character, in order to feel fulfilled, need some kind of adventure in their life.

Someone is imprisoned in isolation from other people as a punishment. Note that while solitary confinement may sometimes be used out of necessity to protect people, its use merely as a punishment is controversial and may constitute torture due to its adverse psychological effects.
A large settlement under water. It might be adapted for air-breathing people somehow,  or it may be inhabited by water breathers.
Someone likes very much to take pictures with a camera.

Some variant of the philosophical concept of determinism is discussed. Determinism is the idea that events can only unfold in a certain way given the preceding state of things; thus history (past, present and future) is fixed and  "free will" is perhaps but an illusion.

There is a situation in which someone is confronted with two equally attractive options. Due to indecision, the chooser fails to decide and the outcome is worse than picking either option could have been.  Background: Buridan's ass is a paradox related to free will that presents a hypothetical situation  wherein an ass (i.e. donkey) that is equally hungry and thirsty is placed precisely between a stack of  hay and a pail of water. The ass dies of both hunger and thirst since it cannot rationally decide  between the hay and the water.
A hypothetical directed energy weapon that induces instant death in its victims.
Someone allows their actions to be unduly influenced by what they desire rather than what is reality, and something bad happens as a consequence.
The social problem of sexually transmitted diseases is discussed.
Someone is unable to act normally, as if they are ill, because they are so in love.
There is a tiny organism (for example a bacteria) that can devour metal.
Someone exhibits an unusual amount of anxiety when encountering new people.

Theme: what if I discovered that I was a facsimile of someone else
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We imagine what it would be like to discover that we are, in fact, merely a copy of someone else who by virtue of prior existence can be considered more genuine.

Someone must decide which action to take even though all potential actions appear equally unappealing. This situation is also allegorically known as "Sheridan's Ass"  after renowned themer Paul Sheridan who noted that it is a mirror reflection  of "Burridan's Ass".
Someone contemplates whether to enter into a presumed monogamous relationship or whether to stay single.
There is a wedding.
Someone looks inwards to understand and take control of their own fears so as not to act irrationally because of them.
The means and methods by which one may prevail in a fist-fight are discussed.
Someone gets a kick out of practicing fighting in a consensual and,  more or less friendly setting.

The issue of to what extent potentially dangerous fighting between consenting  individuals should be allowed as a sport is discussed. Dueling, for example, has completely vanished and heavy boxing, if permitted, is heavily regulated.
These are various techniques that can be used to prevent the expression of a  certain gene, making it as if the gene was not present.
Someone experiences what it is like to face a genius in a fight, competition, or other adversarial situation.
A number of people sit down together with the express purpose of tossing ideas  back and forth in order to find a solution to a specific problem.
The social problem of what to do with toxic waste, for example radioactive garbage, is brought up.
A shower-like device that uses sound vibrations instead of water to dislodge the grit from your body.
Someone seeks to improve their ability to interact socially with other people.
The complex ins and outs (no pun intended) of human mating rituals are discussed.
Someone suffers through being in the vicinity of an intoxicated person who is  acting obnoxiously, for example at a party.
The sometimes contentions process by which deteriorated urban neighborhoods are renovated, resulting in the driving up of prizes and squeezing out of local residents, is featured.

Architectural design for very densely populated, ecologically low-impact human habitats. Arcology is distinguished from a merely large building in that it is designed to lessen  the impact of human habitation on any given ecosystem. It could be self-sustainable, for example.

Theme: to settle down vs. to keep on trekking
Definition: Someone considers whether or not it is time to settle down at specific place instead of traveling around.

Theme: ceasing an opportunity vs. keeping the status quo
Definition: Someone must choose whether or not to upend their current life in order to cease at an opportunity that has presented itself.
Someone deals with not having a job and the typical problems that come with it.
The urge some people have to travel the world and explore new places is featured.
The social problem of people being unemployed against their desire is discussed.

Theme: what if I was yanked out of my normal routine and sent on an important mission
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: Someone is subjected to this fantastical scenario.

The following hypothetical dilemma is considered: If through some marvel of time travel like  technology it is possible to prove that someone is about to commit a crime in the future, can they then be arrested and considered guilty already in the present?
Example: In Philip K. Dick's 1956 science fiction short story "The Minority Report", PreCrime police officers can put people in a detainment camp before they commit the crime they are destined  to commit.

Definition: One or more topics, for example the Y2K bug scare or the general excitement, that are  connected to the shift from the 2nd to the 3rd millennium in the Gregorian calendar, are featured.
We are shown what life was like for people in the second half of the 20th century.
Someone does a self-sacrificial thing in order to save a large number of people from death.
Example: In voy5x25 "Warhead" the eponymous warhead (a sentient bomb) decides to detonate to destroy a number of other bombs instead of letting them complete their missing, thereby saving countless innocent lives.

Definition: The way that someone can, step by step and without particular premeditation, get  drawn into evermore serious crime is featured.
Example: In voy3x13 "Fair Trade" Neelix did a favor for a friend who turned out to be involved in drug smuggling. After covering up some minor transgressions Neelix eventually found  himself an accomplice to serious crime.  In voy5x26 "Equinox (1)" it is told that the Equinox crew accidentally killed an alien and discovered that its body made excellent fuel. Driven by exceptional need they procured another alien which they murdered for fuel, then another and so on.

Definition: Someone realizes that by acting like their enemy they are becoming like their enemy.
We are asked whether an excuse like "I was merely following orders" is acceptable in some scenario where something illegal or unethical has been perpetrated.

Theme: deciding what is best for the patient
Definition: A Doctor alone has to make a decision that will fundamentally affect the future of their patient  in a situation where the patient is not entirely capable of making the choice themselves. The patient might for example be unconscious, immature, or mentally ill.

Theme: what if I went on a journey into the underworld
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: Someone travels to Hell or some other mythological underworld.
Someone discovers a place for religion in their life.

Theme: what if I had a near-death experience
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: Someone is on the brink of death and has peculiar experience as a consequence.
There is an informal but extended, presumed monogamous, romantic relationship  between a male character and a female character.
There is a machine, artificial by definition, imbued with intelligence to the level  that it is considered sentient.
Someone is excited by cars, boats, planes etc. that go fast.
There is a vehicle that is controlled simply by thinking, without using knobs, wheels, levers, etc.
A character is touchy on the subject of their age.

Featured are the contrasts, interactions and potential conflicts that can arise between people who are more gifted in the emotional compartment than the intellectual on the one hand, and those that are more gifted intellectually than emotionally on the other. IQ here refers to the logical math and puzzle solving abilities oft associated with intellectuals. EQ refers to the ability of people to recognize there own and others'  emotions and respond appropriately to them.
Featured are the contrasts, interactions and potential conflicts that can arise between people who are outgoing and extrovert on the one hand, and people who are reclusive and introvert on the other.
Someone has to learn to live with their mind not being as sharp as it once was. This could happen because of aging, brain trauma, or mysterious alien influences.

Theme: choosing what kind of person one wants to be
Definition: Someone ponders a decision regarding what kind of person they want to be in the future.
Example: In voy6x06 "Riddles", Tuvok has amnesia but learns to enjoy life as his new and now emotional self.  When a cure is found, he contemplates whether or not he really wants to go back to being the cold  emotionless Vulcan automaton he had been before.

Definition: A character exhibits a passion for collecting data.
A character is enthusiastic about the subject of history.
Someone realizes that they've learned something important that made them develop as a person, making them more mature and sophisticated as a result.
Someone is an enthusiastic fan of a sport (but not typically a player themself).

The social consequences of the human weakness for sometimes putting undue weight on  circumstantial evidence is featured.  Circumstantial evidence is evidence that relies on an inference to connect it to a  conclusion of fact. This is to say that the conclusion does not follow with 100% certainty; correctly gauging the degree of justified certainty may require careful weighting of probabilities beyond what many people are capable of.

The ever-present dichotomy between quantity and quality is features: Should one strive towards producing many mediocre things or a few high quality things, or is there a sweet  spot somewhere in between?
The potential consequences to society of excessive rumor spreading is discussed.

Theme: what if I could edit my lover
Parent: what if my life were different
Definition: We imagine what it would be like to be able to simply change aspects about our lover as easily as we change clothes.
A romantic relationship between a real person and an artificial person is featured.
There is a virtual personality with which someone corporeal has a love affair.
It is described what life might have been in Ireland during the 18-hundreds.
Man's development from pre-historical primate through various stages of civilization, cultural and scientific development through to our present state is featured more or less in the whole.
Someone deals with the various travails that may come with being famous, such as lack of privacy, creepy stalkers, greedy supplicants, etc. etc.

Theme: being famous is not all it's cracked up to be
Definition: The age old wisdom that it may not be as much fun as it looks to be a celebrity is illustrated.
Someone has to handle being around a conceited and condescending person.
Our human tendency to revere famous people is featured.
A celebrity is accosted by fans who are sexually attracted to him or her and none too shy about it.
There is technology by which memories may be implanted into someone's brain.
There is a staged fight more or less to the death in front of a large audience for their amusement.
The means and methods by which one may overcome a foe in unarmed combat are discussed.
Someone stayed in the sun too long and got roasted like a lamb, then had to live with the consequences.
The notion of fairy folk, from primarily North European folk lore, is brought up.
Someone is subjected to practical jokes by a persons who does such things.
Someone has feelings of romantic attraction to someone else but is too shy to say anything.

Theme: what if someone I knew returned from the dead
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: A character believes someone they know is dead and gone, but after some time that person  comes back.

Theme: what if I was brought back to life long after my death
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: Someone dies and is gone for a long enough time that their friends and family have moved on, but is then resurrected from the dead.

Theme: letting go of someone you love
Parent: coping with having to do something
Definition: Someone will part with someone they love and must come to terms with the fact.

Theme: sacrificing a loved one to defeat an enemy
Definition: Someone struggles with whether or not to sacrifice a loved one in the struggle against  some vicious foe.
A young person is made to perform a science project of some sort in school, or some  equivalent scenario.
Someone repeatedly comes up short of expectations in school or at work etc. and must deal with the associated feelings and problems.
The stereotypical divide in science between those who are inclined towards pure theory one one hand, and those who are inclined to practice and experiments on the other, is featured.

Theme: getting away with using your working time to pursue your own passions
Definition: Someone is busy at work but not with their assigned tasks so much as with their private  passions and interests.
There is a life form somehow constituted of a hypothetical kind of matter known as "dark matter".
There is a character who plays an elaborate confidence trick of some sort on another character.
Someone has been defrauded and must come to terms with the emotions and other problems that  can come in the aftermath of such a misfortune.

Theme: the power of art to influence society
Definition: The idea is expressed that ideas expressed skillfully through art have the potential to  influence and shape society.
There is a society which is ruled by a despot with more or less absolute power. This should not be confused with totalitarianism, which is more severe.
A character reflects on their life with caustic bitterness over things that did not turn out to their satisfaction.
The human need to be part of and accepted into a social group is demonstrated.

A character is unable to go about their normal daily life because of some affliction and this changes their social interactions in a disagreeable way. They may, for example, resent being treated like an invalid by their well-meaning friends.
Someone has to come to terms with the fact that they are not entirely self-reliant but do in fact rely on friends and colleagues for practical and emotional support.
The idea that international sporting events (Olympic Games, FIFA World Cup, etc.) can be valuable in promoting peace between nations is featured. The "Olympic Truce" is an ancient Greek example.
A male character in a relationship is inattentive to their partner's emotional needs.
A female character in a relationship is annoying their partner by being overly demanding of time and attention.
Someone is in a relationship where they feel their partner doesn't pay sufficient  attention to them.
The psychological study of sensory stimuli that are below an individual's threshold for  conscious perception.

The question of appropriate balance between the public expectation of privacy on one hand and  various social, legal and political issues on the other, are discussed. Is it, for example,  acceptable for the government to snoop on innocent people's browsing habits in order to pick up on  potential terrorist threats?
There is a Kafkaesque society in which much of daily life is a maddening series of seemingly  pointless bureaucratic procedures.
There is a functioning society that is nevertheless for some reason depressing and horrifying  to contemporary eyes.
The ramifications of people receiving different quality of medical care depending on social  status are explored.
Someone learns to be careful with whom they trust because there are many clever scoundrels around.
We are asked to what extent, if any, homosexuality should be tolerated in society and how homosexual people ought to be treated.
The dilemma of choosing one or the other between two unethical regimes when not choosing would probably lead to the worst outcome of all, is featured.
Someone believes themselves to be a divinely chosen leader and savior of their people.

Theme: coping with being of mixed race
Definition: Someone has parents or grandparents of mixed ethnicity and must cope with the various social issues that can come from being physically or culturally with one foot each in two different worlds.
Someone exhibits a fear that someone they love (for example a husband or a dad) will leave them.

Theme: what if perpetrators were sentenced by their victims
Definition: We are brought to imagine a legal system wherein the perpetrator of a crime has his punishment decided by the victims of said crime (or the next of kin in case of murder).
The connection between a person's brain chemistry and their propensity for anti-social  behavior is discussed.

People of different social classes are treated differently in the legal system when they commit the same type of crimes. For example, a rich man may get away with murder while a poor man of an ethnic minority is sent to the gallows.
Someone irreverently makes a clever interpretation of religious texts so as to fit  their own agenda.
There appears to be a fourth spatial dimension into which movement is somewhat and somehow possible.
Someone ate something bad and now has an upset stomach.
There is technology by which someone can be physically altered to look notably different.  Typically this means that the shape of their face is changed. Application of makeup does not count.
A female character in a relationship is so fond of collecting items that it unsettles her partner.
Someone is afraid of expressing or acting out their feelings and innermost desires.

Theme: coping with having a chronic condition
Definition: Someone has an intractable, constantly recurring disease or other medical condition that they just have to live with. This may involve regular visits to the doctor and onerous treatment procedures.
Someone has to decide how they want to weight the amount of time they spend on work against the  amount of time they spend on other pursuits in life.

Theme: deferring to unappealing laws in a foreign society
Definition: We are asked when and to what extent people from one civilization ought to defer to the laws of  another society when those laws appear bad, unjust, or outright immoral.

Theme: defamation of character vs. freedom of speech
Definition: We are made to ponder where the limits of free speech should be drawn. Should outright lies that hurt someone else's reputation be persecuted or is that a slippery slope towards totalitarianism?
A character thinks deep and long about what their family means to them.

Theme: the dangers of sending information out into space
Definition: The potentially adverse consequences of sending messages or space probes etc. out into space are discussed. One idea is that they may alert an advanced and hostile alien species to our existence.
An unmanned spacecraft that has been dispatch outside the solar system.

The ethical dilemma of when and under what circumstances it is permissible, or even imperative, for one society to intervene in the internal affairs of another. If, for example, some people in the other society are oppressed by a genocidal dictator, liberal democratic societies may feel a collective duty to intervene.

Theme: the ethics of interfering with lost tribes
Definition: The ethical dilemma of whether it is permissible, or even imperative, for advanced societies to make contact with such tribes as do not otherwise have any outside contact. Interaction would  irrevocably change their societies, but it may not be right to force isolation upon them either.
The abhorrent and antediluvian notion that one ethnicity is superior and therefore a moral duty to assert their authority over "lesser" peoples is featured.

Theme: coping with a pedantic authority figure
Definition: A subordinate is having trouble with their boss being overly critical of their work.
The potential consequences of developing weapons that can to a large extent operate on their own are discussed.
There is a weapons system that has a sufficient degree of artificial intelligence so as to select targets and operate entirely on its own, once unleashed.
An asteroid has been turned into a living space suitable for humans.
Interesting minerals are extracted from an asteroid.

Theme: obeying the rules vs. acting for a just cause
Definition: Someone weighs whether to break with rules in order do a perceived good deed.
Example: In tng5x07 "Unification I", Spock disobeys his government by traveling to Romulus and working with the resistance there to undermine the government and bring about peace with  The Federation.  In voy5x09 "Thirty Days", Tom disobeyed Janeway's direct orders and broke the Prime Directive in order to save an aquatic alien home-world from destruction at the hands of their own greedy elite.

Definition: Someone challenges our typical preconceptions of gender roles and attitudes, for example by  behaving like the opposite sex that they are.
The troubles and tribulations faced by a society that has just experienced the ravages of war are featured.
There is a society in which sizable groups of people with different ethnicities seek to live together under a common law.
A virus, bacterium or equivalent type of infectious substance has been engineered by human hand.
The category of as-yet fictional things that may conceivably be done with bioengineering  techniques in the future.
Aphasia is an inability to comprehend and formulate language because of damage to specific  brain regions.
Something from medical science is featured.
There is bullying or coercion of a sexual nature, or the unwelcome or inappropriate promise of  rewards in exchange for sexual favors.
The embarrassingly human enthusiasm for arranging and watching deadly fights between animals or other humans is featured.
The ways by which humans can be enticed to purchase goods and services are discussed.
There is a classic Jekyll and Hyde scenario.

Theme: what if I underwent an apotheosis
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: We are made to imagine what it would be like to be worshiped as a god.

Theme: the ethics of interfering in the internal affairs of other powers
Definition: The ethical justifications for supporting or opposing one political entity intervening in the affairs of another nation as part of its foreign policy are explored.
The love of a parent for their child is featured.
A conflict between a person and technology is featured.

Theme: coping with having a bad day
Definition: A character copes with having one of those days when everything that seemingly can go wrong, does go wrong.

Theme: what if I were stranded in outer space
Parent: what if I faced an incredible situation
Definition: A character is stranded in outer space.
The ethics of spying on others is explored.
An act that constitutes a serious violation of the laws of war that gives rise to individual criminal responsibility is featured.
A proposed type of planet-to-space transportation system using a cable anchored to the a planetary surface that extends into space
A character manifests pleasure in the regaling of their audience with the telling of a story.
A character must overcome an internal struggle within themself.
Civilization on a planet is threatened when asteroids are directed on a collision course with the planet.
